general_advisory: Farmers are advised to conduct harvesting, sowing and spraying operations accordingly. Make provision to take proper care of crops and animals to protect them from cold. Complete the sowing of Rabi crops like Mustard, Til, Chickpea, Groundnut, Green gram/Black Gram and start nursery sowing of Summer Paddy where irrigation facilities are available.

advisory: There is some rainfall event expected in the first half of upcoming days, so farmers are advised to wait for harvesting operations and store the harvested paddy crop properly to avoid damage.
Seed treatment with carbendazim and imidacloprid is recommended before sowing.
Seed should be sown with a spacing of 30cm x 10cm.
Recommended varieties include Kamadeva, Durga, IPM 02-3 for Green Gram and Prasada, Usala, PU 31 for Black Gram.
Avoid irrigation for some days due to expected rainfall.
Use improved Groundnut varieties like TAG-24, JL-24, Girnar-3 for sowing.
Ensure seed treatment before sowing and treat with bacteria or phospho culture after 7 days.
Regular monitoring against insect attack is advised.
Use straw as mulching material to maintain soil moisture and temperature.
Regular monitoring against Diamond back moth attack is important.
Spraying of neem oil or Emamectin Benzoate is advised after rain if attack is observed.
Protect animals from cold by using jute bag as cover and straw as bedding material.
Provide clean drinking water and keep sheds clean to prevent diseases.
Vaccination and deworming are important to control diseases.
Ensure proper ventilation in poultry sheds.
Use external heat sources to keep sheds warm and dry.
Maintain drinking water at suitable temperature.
